channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024120126
item.description:
Report E-2024120126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: GREENEVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 6, 2024, Roadrunner Transportation Systems reported one 55-gallon metal drum of Zirconium Octoate (UN1993, 3, III) was damaged, resulting in the release of approximately 10 gallons of product. The release was contained to a 10 x 6 area of the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched and cleaned up the release with absorbents, and simple green. The damaged drum was overpacked and forwarded on to the consignee. All was generated was containerized in (3) 55-gallon metal drums which were taken offsite pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110380
item.description:
Report E-2024110380

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/11/2024, at 0709 hours, personnel in the CSXT Wauhatchie Yard in Chattanooga, Tennessee, discovered PROX32359, a tank car, residue: last contained, Butane leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Centennial Energy was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-11-11-00010). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found an active leak from the protective housing. Upon further inspection it was found to have the B-end liquid valve partially open; and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight with no thread tape applied. The vapor valve was also found to be partially open with the secondary closure plug less than tool tight without thread tape. Contractor personnel we able to close both valves, apply thread tape to the secondary plugs and secure them with a wrench. The issues identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- Nick Petrosky (303-370-7102, npetrosky@centennialenergy.us).

  • City: MURFREESBORO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package did not appear to have any damage on the outside of the box however, it had a strong odor coming from inside. There were two cans of CRC QD Contact Cleaner and only one of them had a puncture on the side that resulted in a leak. There were 8 other items inside the package that were covered in the residue.

item.title: Report X-2024120145
item.description:
Report X-2024120145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 12/01/2024 at approximately 1055, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 11 plastic jerricans, one of which appeared to have spilled due to a loose closure. The spilled jerrican was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held, awaiting an amended Shipper's Declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report I-2024120006
item.description:
Report I-2024120006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-17
  • City: Knoxville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GRAMMER INDUSTRIES INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While doing a routine inspection at TruckStop, a leak was discovered coming from the bottom gasket on tank truck. A slow drip of product was detected on the asphalt surface beneath truck. Less than 6 ounces of nitric acid were released and contained to immediate area. Marion Environmental was dispatched to assess site. Upon arrival on site, Marion Environmental tightened the bolts on Leaking gasket which stopped the release. Absorbent material was applied to the affected asphalt, which was worked in and recovered into one 55-gallon drum. The truck was. Monitored overnight without further incident and then sent on to its destination. There were no injuries or exposures reported

item.title: Report X-2024120103
item.description:
Report X-2024120103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 21st a package was discovered leaking during the AM sort. The package contained a drum that contained UN1988, ALDEHYDES FLAMMABLE TOXIC NOS, 3(6.1), III. It appears that the leak occurred at the closure of the drum. The drum was placed into a steel salvage drum and an amended shippers declaration was requested.
